channel.title: Game Design!
channel.description:
Hey everyone!
Lately I have been trying to create my own 3d rpg. I know what I want it to be, but I am having trouble getting started. I need your all's help on some questions I have. Like....Is the best way to make a game by reading books, and trying to code your own game, or just download a game design program??? I have a java game programing book, but it is 2d, and I don't know how much I am going to be able to get out of it. I also know two pretty good game design programs. So if anyone could help me out with some of these, and if you know some about game design can you tell me how you learned it.
Also I just thought of this. I do know some about coding RSPS, and I could make my game off of here. But I would have to make my own map, and is that even possible? If so, just give me some starting info and I will research it further.

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @SJT SJT
item.description:
@SJT wrote:

justinxg27:

I once tried to catch a shark too. Ended up only with seaweed.

how did your rep go down?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Ok, I will do that. Thanks for all of your help guys!

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:28, topic:349873”]Ok well I have a c++ coding book. So should I read that first, then get a book about coding minor games?[/quote]Yep, also check out cplusplus.com if you need any help.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Ok well I have a c++ coding book. So should I read that first, then get a book about coding minor games?

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:26, topic:349873”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=446248.msg3277042#msg3277042 date=1279597340]

Sorry I didn’t mean program. What is the best language to use to make a game…like java, c++ code stuff lik that.

It depends what you want to do with it. I would recommend c++ if it’s going to be graphic intensive.
[/quote]

Ok thanks dude, I just don’t know how to start making a game with that kind of code.[/quote]

Pick a language and learn it first. You won’t be making any good 3D games without advanced knowledge.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4

[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:22, topic:349873”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=446248.msg3276376#msg3276376 date=1279561078]
First of all if you wanna make a good 3d game you’ll need to know how physics function through math, you gotta be able to do the math.
[/quote]
Not if hes using an engine.[/quote]Didn’t read that part, I believe the Half-Life 2 engine is free along with the game, I recommend using that. Although I’m betting you can probably get it free @ www.phazeDDL.com

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Java Is My Bitch:

First of all if you wanna make a good 3d game you’ll need to know how physics function through math, you gotta be able to do the math.

Not if hes using an engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

b b0yz 4:

What do you all think is the best program for making games?

Umm… If you use a program to make a game, it’s most likely not going to be original. I can understand using a gaming engine as a base but any descent one is going to cost quite a bit.

Best bet is to program your own game engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:16, topic:349873”]I will be 100% honest with you, i recommend making your first game either being one of those cmd-type games or a game just based on drawing simple pixels.

IDEAS FOR THE LATTER:

  • Snake
  • Pong
  • Pac-Man[/quote]

I don’t know how to start making those kind of games though.

And Pure2ownage, thanks I will probably go ahead and do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:14, topic:349873”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=446248.msg3275103#msg3275103 date=1279483361]
Best way to make a game is to go to college for it.
[/quote]

Ye but the sad thinh is im only 13…I was gonna go to camp for it…but too much money, and there are no schools around me that support it. And also on your other reply, I know that…I am just trying to get started with making a game. I feel like I know some about java coding (agin I know coding RSPS isn’t the same as making games) so I think I might be better at coding a java game (my book is also a java coding book too).

[quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=446248.msg3275150#msg3275150 date=1279485249]

[quote author=Primadude link=topic=446248.msg3275137#msg3275137 date=1279484539]

Or… Download a Emulator such as VisualBoyAdvance and get a ROM such as pokemon, find a way to decrypt it and study the code
edit: nvm thats 2d

The newer pokemon games are 3D.
[/quote]VisualBoyAdvance only emulates gameboy color / advance; but yeh he can try to use a different emulator with newer versions of pokemon, a good resource for ROMs is CoolROM

If your just looking for a GBA emulator, DO NOT use visual boy advance, as it can be lagged easily. I suggest using NO$GBA, since it can emulate GBA and DS games.

Desmume is better for DS games imo.
[/quote]imo KFusion is the best but that’s not for gba/gbc games

And too all of you all who said something in that. I am not looking into making a gameboy game. I want to make a pc game.[/quote]It will help you get the basics of 2d games before you develop it into 3d.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Design!
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

I will be 100% honest with you, i recommend making your first game either being one of those cmd-type games or a game just based on drawing simple pixels.

IDEAS FOR THE LATTER:

  • Snake
  • Pong
  • Pac-Man

Read full topic

Best way to make a game is to go to college for it.

Ye but the sad thinh is im only 13…I was gonna go to camp for it…but too much money, and there are no schools around me that support it. And also on your other reply, I know that…I am just trying to get started with making a game. I feel like I know some about java coding (agin I know coding RSPS isn’t the same as making games) so I think I might be better at coding a java game (my book is also a java coding book too).

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:12, topic:349873”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=446248.msg3275137#msg3275137 date=1279484539]

[quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=446248.msg3275135#msg3275135 date=1279484488]

Or… Download a Emulator such as VisualBoyAdvance and get a ROM such as pokemon, find a way to decrypt it and study the code
edit: nvm thats 2d

The newer pokemon games are 3D.
[/quote]VisualBoyAdvance only emulates gameboy color / advance; but yeh he can try to use a different emulator with newer versions of pokemon, a good resource for ROMs is CoolROM

If your just looking for a GBA emulator, DO NOT use visual boy advance, as it can be lagged easily. I suggest using NO$GBA, since it can emulate GBA and DS games.

Desmume is better for DS games imo.
[/quote]imo KFusion is the best but that’s not for gba/gbc games :([/quote]

And too all of you all who said something in that. I am not looking into making a gameboy game. I want to make a pc game.

Read full topic
